page.title: 18TOURISM
page.content: Many tourists visit this area. In Kersey there are the Weavers' Houses. Also in this area we have the site of Lindsey Castle of which only earth works remain. However the Chapel of St.James, an ancient monument, is still in excellent repair, though altered through time and use. The nearby Church at Lindsey has many mediaeval features. The Village of Kersey, only partly on this area is very much visited. It is heavily parked at weekends and in the Summer holiday periods: Kersey and Lindsey woollens were historically famous and many thousands of visitors from the continent and from the United States, which itself has special historical ties with Suffolk, come here. The area is very accessible to the ports of Felixstowe and Harwich which have frequent ferries.
